s.text: Yet, it is fair to ask whether the diversion of public funds from public schools weakens and further threatens what was once a powerful institution of upward mobility for the poor and immigrants.
Moreover, such school programs offer the working class and the poor the same opportunities that the wealthy have to send their children to alternative schools.
So, as you note this is an awfully late breakfast.
Yet, it is fair to ask whether the diversion of public funds from public schools weakens and further threatens what was once a powerful institution of upward mobility for the poor and immigrants.
